grid.frequencydescription: Commonly used frequencies are listed here, and are all USB. Simply click on a entry or manually enter a frequency in the textbox to tune your rig if rig control is enabled.
grid.savepreset_help: Save current grid layout as a preset that can be restored using restore preset button
grid.restorepreset_help: Restore your saved grid preset (clears current grid)
grid.cleargrid_help: Clear all items from the grid
grid.gridwidgetsdescription: Grid widgets allow you to customize the display. You may add additional widgets to fit your needs. You can move and resize the individual widgets!
grid.downloadpreset_help: Download preset file for sharing or saving

components.ping_help: Send a ping request to a remote station
components.newmessage_help: Send a new message to a remote station
components.startnewchat_help: Start or continue a conversation with another station
components.cqcqcq_help: Send a CQ to the world
components.togglebeacon_help: Toggle beacon mode. While sending a beacon, you can receive ping requests and open a datachannel. If a datachannel is opened, the beacon pauses.

modals.startnewchat2: Start a new chat (enter dx call sign first)
modals.newchatline4: Check the chat tab on left side for messages
modals.audiotuninginfo: Adjust audio levels. Value in dB. Default value is 0
modals.remoteinfo: For remote operation, please go to settings/modem and set the server ip to 0.0.0.0
modals.furthersettings: For further settings please go to settings/modem
modals.restartserveronproblem: In case of unusual problems, you can reload the internal modem manually. If the problem persists, consider a server restart.
modals.manualmodemrestart_help: Restart the modem. Please set your audio and radio settings first!
modals.radiocontrolinfo: This is just a quick setting! For further options, please go to settings/rig control
modals.rigcontrolmethoddisabled: Disabled (no rig control; use with VOX)
modals.systeminfoalert: Please share this information when opening an issue

chat.selectChat: Please select or create a chat

gui.introduction: GUI related settings like customizing waterfall theme, language or browser behaviour.
gui.browserautolaunch_help: Launch browser to GUI URL on server startup
gui.selectlanguage_help: Select the preferred language used for GUI
gui.waterfalltheme_help: Select color theme for waterfall display

station.introduction: Station related settings, like changing your callsign, location and general behaviour.
station.callsign_help: Enter a valid callsign (Max 7 chars, no special chars)
station.callsign_placeholder: Enter your callsign and save it
station.callsignssid_help: Set a SSID for this station
station.locator_help: Enter a grid locator (Max 6 chars; shorter will randomize)
station.respondtocq: Respond to CQ callings with a QRV reply
station.respondtocq_help: QRV reply sent with random delay

chat.introduction: Message related settings, like enabling message auto repeat and configuring ADIF log connection.
chat.enableadifloggingudp_help: ADIF Logging via UDP instead of TCP

modem.introduction: Modem and Audio related settings, including starting/stopping the modem, configuring audio devices, and adjusting audio levels.
modem.serverrestart_notification: Settings in RED require a server restart!
modem.restartserver_help: Start or stop the modem. Ensure your audio and radio settings are configured first.
modem.modemport_help: Set the modem port. A server restart is required
modem.modemhost_help: set the modem host address. A server restart is required
modem.audioinputdevice_help: Select your microphone or line-in device
modem.audiooutputdevice_help: Select your speaker or line-out device
modem.rxaudiolevel_help: Adjust to set the receive audio gain
modem.txaudiolevel_help: Adjust to set the transmit audio gain
modem.maximumbandwidth_help: Select the maximum bandwidth the modem will use
modem.enabletxautoadjust_help: Set TX audio level automatically to highest possible value
modem.enablerxautoadjust_help: Set RX audio level automatically to highest possible value

web.introduction: Explorer related settings, including enabling Explorer publishing and Explorer stats publishing.
web.description: Publish information like your frequency or heard stations to https://explorer.freedata.app, so other users can see your stations status. Publishing stats is currently under development and might be broken.
web.enableexplorer_help: Share your station's status with FreeDATA web service
web.enablestats_help: Share your station's statistics with FreeDATA web service

exp.introduction: Warning: These features may be incomplete. They are for experienced users ONLY!
exp.info: Info: No features publishes for testing, yet
exp.enableringbuffer_help: Enable an experimental ring buffer which can be more efficient on low power CPU
exp.enablevhf: Enable VHF modes -- only CQ for now --
exp.enablevhf_help: Enable experimental VHF modes for testing and playing

radio.introduction: Rig Control related settings, including selecting your rig control method and configuring specific settings.
radio.rigcontroltype_help: Choose how the software controls your radio
radio.serialpttcomport_help: Select the COM port connected to your radio for PTT control
radio.serialpttcustomcomport_help: Override the com port of your radio if its not listed above
radio.serialpttviadtr_help: Configure DTR line behavior for PTT control
radio.serialpttviarts_help: Configure RTS line behavior for PTT control
radio.hamlibrigctldhost_help: Enter the IP address of the rigctld server
radio.hamlibrigctldport_help: Enter the port number of the rigctld server
radio.hamlibrigctldradiomodel_help: Select your radio model for rig control
radio.hamlibrigctldcomport_help: Select the serial port connected to your radio
radio.hamlibrigctldcustomcomport_help: Override the com port of your radio if its not listed above
radio.hamlibrigctldserialspeed_help: Set the baud rate for serial communication
radio.hamlibrigctlddatabits_help: Choose the number of data bits
radio.hamlibrigctldstopbits_help: Set the baud rate for serial communication
radio.hamlibrigctldhandshake: Choose the number of stop bits
radio.hamlibrigctldpttdeviceport_help: Select the port used for PTT control
radio.hamlibrigctldptttype_help: Select the method for PTT control
radio.hamlibrigctlddcd_help: Select the Data Carrier Detect method
radio.hamlibrigctldcustomarguments_help: Additional arguments for rigctld (usually not needed)
radio.flrigport_help: Set the port where the flrig server is listening (Default: 12345)
radio.flrighost_help: Set the host adress of the server, mostly localhost or 127.0.0.1
